doc.title: Results a touch right but guidance update more mixed
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/South32 Ltd. Results a touch light but guidance update more mixedSouth32 Ltd. Results a touch light but guidance update _2025-08-28

passages.text: We expect a marginally negative share price reaction, driven by marginally lower than expected FY27 volume guidance, lower than expected Cannington mine plan and higher unit costs for FY26. Positives include lower FY26 capex guidance \((- 6\%)\) and Taylor project still within budget on on track.

Overall FY25 EBITDA and EPS \(- 2\%\) and \(- 3\%\) vs our sets, and \(- 2\%\) and \(- 5\%\) vs company- compiled consensus, while the final dividend of 2.6c (40% payout) was \(- 33\%\) vs our sets (57% payout est) and \(- 19\%\) vs consensus (44% payout). This takes FY dividend to 6c/sh, \(- 18\%\) vs our est and \(- 9\%\) vs consensus. Management has extended the existing buyback by 12 months with \(\) 144m\(remaining. The balance sheet ended in a net cash position of\) \ \(123m\) vs our net cash estimate of \(\) 200m\(and consensus net cash of\) \ \(149m\) driven mainly by weaker operating cash flows. The update for Cannington's mine plan sees a \(- 12\%\) reduction in mine throughput over FY26- 31 to ensure consistent and reliable volumes can be delivered at the lower rates. For both FY26 and FY27 Cannington guidance is meaningfully lower than our forecasts and consensus. Elsewhere, FY27 production guidance was marginally weaker than our forecasts for alumina (- 2% vs our sets), aluminium (- 2%), Australia Mn (- 6%), partially offset by higher volumes at Sierra Gorda (throughput \(+2\%\) and copper \(+6\%\) but moly \(- 59\%\) ) - on a weighted average basis FY27 guidance is \(- 4\%\) vs our forecast. FY26 unit cost guidance was also marginally higher than expected (+1.2% on weighted average basis) driven by Sierra Gorda (+6% vs our est), Mn (Aus \(+5\%\) , SA \(+15\%\) ) and Cannington (+4%). On the positive side, 1) management has lowered capex guidance by \(\) 100m\(to\) \ \(1.4bn\) from prioritization of spend; and 2) Hermosa construction is going well with management noting that all construction packages awarded so far falls within the budgets at the time of FID while timelines for the project remains on track.

- FY25 EBITDA was \(-2\%\) vs. our estimate (-2% vs consensus) with most of the beat vs our estimate driven by better-than-expected performance at Cerro Matoso (+14% vs our est., \(+19\%\) vs cons.), South Africa Aluminium (+5% vs our est., \(-10\%\) vs cons.) and Worsley Alumina (+1% vs our est., \(+1\%\) vs cons.). Further down the P&L, in-line D&A, lower net interest and lower tax effect EPS at 14.8c/sh, \(-3\%\) vs our est and \(-5\%\) vs cons. Net cash position came in at \(\) 123m\(vs our net cash estimate of\) \ \(203m\) and consensus net cash of \(\) 149m\(with the miss vs our estimates mostly from lower operating cash flows.
- Dividend miss our est and consensus; buyback extended: Final dividend of 2.60c/sh (40% payout) was \(-33\%\) vs our est and \(-19\%\) vs cons. This takes FY dividend to 6.00c/sh (41%)
This research report has been prepared in whole or in part by equity research analysts based outside the US who are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 6. Completed: 28-Aug-25, 01:06 GMT Released: 28-Aug-25, 01:07 GMT Restricted - External
European Metals & Mining
Potential Upside/Downside Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
payout). Management has extended the existing buyback programme by 12 months with \(\) 144\(m remaining.

- FY26 unit cost guidance higher than expected: FY26 unit cost guidance was higher than expected driven by Sierra Gorda (+6%, \(\) 17.00\(/tv\) \ \(16/t est\) , Aus Mn (+5%, \(\) 2.40\(/dmtu vs\) \ \(2.28 / dmtu est\) , SA Mn (+15%, \(\) 3.10\(/dmtu vs\) \ \(2.69 / dmtu est\) and Cannington (+4%, \(\) 205/t vs\) \ \(197/t est\) , partially offset by lower guidance at Cerro Matoso (-6%, \(\) 5.30/\(lb vs\) \ \(5.63 / lb\) ). On an absolute cost weighted average basis, unit costs are \(+1.2\%\) vs our estimates.

- FY27 production marginally below expectations: FY27 production guidance were marginally below expectations at Worsley (-1% vs our est, 1% vs BBG cons.), Brazil Alumina (-4%/-4%), SA aluminium (-1%/-0%), Brazil aluminium (-8%/-5%), Aus Mn (-6%/-3%), Cannington (zinc -1%/-16%, lead -18%/-21%, silver -17%/-24%), but partly offset by higher output at Sierra Gorda (throughput +2%/+1%, copper +6%/+5%, but moly -59%/-67%) and SA Mn (+9%/-0%) - on a weighted average basis FY27 guidance is -4% vs our forecast. FY26 guidance is largely unchanged except for Cannington's updated mine plan.

- FY26 capex guidance reduced by \(\) 100\(m: Group sustaining capex guidance incl EAls for FY26 of\) \ \(650m\) is -15% vs our estimates and compares to guidance provided in May 2025 of - \(\) 750m\(. Including growth capex guidance of\) \ \(750m\) (unchanged), overall capex guidance of \(\) 1,400m\(is - 7%\) vs our est and compares to guidance of \(\) 1,500m\(provided in May 2025.

- Cannington reset: Management has revised the UG mine plan to average at -1.8mtpa over FY26-31, down from 2-2.1mtpa in response to UG challenges. This should ensure reliable volumes with focus now to reduce cost base further than what was guided for 2026 from the ongoing review. With higher silver prices, management are also doing studies for potential open pit development with potential upside vs current reserve life of 6 years from both further UG and open pit development. FY26 and FY27 production guidance is meaningfully lower than our expectations and consensus (see Figure 2).

- Hermosa/Taylor project on track and on budget: Hermosa construction is going well with management noting that all construction packages awarded so far falls within the budgets at the time of FID while timelines for the project remains on track.

- Other: 1) FY26 D&A guidance of \(\) 780m\(vs our est of\) \ \(779m\) ; 2) Group and unallocated expenses in EBIT of \(\) 120m\(our est\) \ \(125m\) ; 3) net finance costs \(\) 190m\(vs our est of\) \ \(202m\)

Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Positive - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
Neutral - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Negative - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.

Source: IDC, Barclays ResearchLink to Barclays Live for interactive charting
On 27-Aug-2022, prior to any intra-day change that may have been published, the rating for this security was Underweight, and the adjusted price target was 1.93.
Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
*This is the closing price referenced in the publication, which may not be the last available closing price at the time of publication.
Historical stock prices and price targets may have been adjusted for stock splits and dividends.

**Valuation Methodology:** Our price target of 200p is based on 1.1x NPV; reflecting our economists' view that recession is likely to be avoided, we apply our pre-Liberation Day 1.1x multiple assumption.

**Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target:** Risks to our price target include commodity prices, exchange rates, operating problems at the mines, environmental permitting issues for new or existing projects and M&A activity (+/-ve). Key risks for South Africa in particular include the NERSA review of aluminium power pricing, BEE compliance audit and Eskom coal contracts extending beyond the existing life of mine (-ve). Improvement in the operating conditions in South Africa following the appointment of a new President with a different view on mining presents upside risks, although there is still uncertainty on the mining charter review.

Sustainable Investing Related Research: There is currently no globally accepted framework or definition (legal, regulatory or otherwise) of, nor market consensus as to what constitutes a 'sustainable', 'ESG', 'green', 'climate- friendly' or an equivalent company, investment, strategy or consideration or what precise attributes are required to be eligible to be categorised by such terms. This means there are different ways to evaluate a company or an investment and so different values may be placed on certain sustainability credentials as well as adverse ESG- related impacts of companies and ESG controversies. The evolving nature of sustainable investing considerations, models and methodologies means it can be challenging to definitively and universally classify a company or investment under a sustainable investing label and there may be areas where such companies and investments could improve or where adverse ESG- related impacts or ESG controversies exist. The evolving nature of sustainable finance related regulations and the development of jurisdiction- specific regulatory criteria also means that there is likely to be a degree of divergence as to the interpretation of such terms in the market. We expect industry guidance, market practice, and regulations in this field to continue to evolve.
